description: Unique identifier of the asset for which the meter reading was recorded; links readings to a specific vehicle/equipment record.
Business classification of the asset used for reporting and to interpret meter units and maintenance rules.
Sequential number of the reading for this asset, indicating the order of captures over time.
Timestamp when the meter reading was taken on the asset.
Type and unit of the meter being recorded (e.g., miles, hours, kilometers) for the reading.
Numeric value of the asset’s meter at read_dt in the specified meter_type; typically cumulative, but may reset on meter replacement.
Maintenance work order number associated with the reading, often captured during service intake or completion.
User ID or process that created the reading record (e.g., migration job, integration, or human entry).
Date and time the reading record was created in the system.
User ID that last modified the reading record.
Date and time the reading record was last updated.
Likely identifier of the asset’s location or depot at the time of reading; confirm with SME.
Likely activity or reason code tied to the reading (e.g., PM service, inspection); confirm with SME.
Likely status flag for the reading (e.g., estimated, rollover, corrected, invalid); confirm with SME.
Likely manufacturer serial number or VIN for the asset recorded with the reading; confirm with SME.
